context.text: Case Closed: The Fourteenth Target - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Original Name English Dub Name Original Cast English Dub

In this movie, Rachel (Ran) has a nightmare about her mother dying, but soon regains memory of some of the events that happened to her. Meanwhile, there has been murders/injuries at people who all have some relation to "The Great" Richard Moore( Mori Kogoro), and that all their names corresponded to a playing card. These people were targeted in order, from King down to Ace. The police concludes that this person wanted revenge on Richard Moore, but as these injuries become murders, Conan realizes that it is a race to predict who the victims will be. He soon discoverers something quite different from what the police suspected, while learning about an incident from 10 years ago.

Case Closed: the Fourteenth Target is the 2nd of the Detective Conan movies. It was released in Japanese theaters on April 18th , 1998 , with an English version was released on DVD only on November 20 , 2007 . The box office grossed 1.05 billion. English trailer .

The movie opens to a dream sequence in which Rachel sees her mother get shot. This is later revealed to be a suppressed memory , of when her mother was shot by her father, to save her life. The Moores, Eva Kadan (Rachel s mother) and Conan go out to eat dinner at a fancy restaurant, and meet up with an old acquaintance of the family. He is a wine taster , one of the best in the world.
You can assist by editing it now. A how-to guide is available. (April 2008)
This article or section needs copy editing for grammar, style, cohesion, tone or spelling.

The next day Inspector Megure is jogging in the park, when all of a sudden he is attacked with a crossbow. Near the where the incident occurred, a strange looking knife is found, which Conan thinks he has seen it somewhere before. It is revealed that this "knife" is made from paper machete . This injures him and places him in the hospital. Richard, Conan, and Rachel then go visit Megure, and Megure refuses to remove his hat (this is a running gag in the series). This is where Jimmy/Conan learns Megure's first name, Joseph. Once they leave, we see Eva Kadan get a box of chocolates delivered to her at her office. She mistakenly believes they were sent by Richard, and eats them. She then passes out. We learn the chocolates were poisoned , and Megure, still recovering, join the rest of the group in Eva's hospital room. There was a paper machete flower attached to her favorite brand of chocolate. Once again, Conan finds the clue (an odd flower) familiar. It seems the crimes are connected.
It contains a plot summary that is too long compared to the rest of the article . Tagged since May 2008.
This article or section has multiple issues. Please help improve the article or discuss these issues on the talk page .

The next day Dr. Agasa is attacked, by a crossbow, by a motorist and Conan gives chase. Eventually though the motorist gets away. Conan finds the clue the motorist left behind this time, it is a paper machete Sceptre . He concludes all the "clues" are from a standard deck of regular playing cards . They are each items a "face card" is holding. Starting from the highest card (King of Spades) and going down. The king is holding a knife , the queen a flower , and the Jack a sceptre . Each victim is represented by a regular playing card. The order of the attacks starts from the highest card (King of Spade) and goes down in order. Victims of face cards "clues" are objects that are being held in the playing card. Victims of non-face cards are represented by the playing card itself. It is revealed that Jimmy Kudo is the Ace of Spades. Inspector Megure, and Richard Moore believe the killer/attacker is a card dealer turn criminal they both helped to arrest in the past(the same person who held Richard's wife hostage). They think he wants revenge against the two, and to harm/kill all of Richard's friends and acquaintances. Richard mistakenly believes the next victim (number 8) is an acquaintance he knows from a bar. The police surround the building at sundown and protect it all night. Conan helps the police realize that she may not be the 8th target, because another of Richard's friend Hiroki Tsuji (the Pro Golfer) is ranked 8th best golfer in the world. The police decide to split up. Half stay with the women from the bar, Megure, Conan, Rachel, Richard, and a few police officers go to protect the golfer. Tsuji has been planning on flying his helicopter for weeks, and refuses to cancel his flight. So Richard and Megure decide to ride with him in order to protect him (and Conan sneaks aboard). As they take off her puts eye drops in his eyes for his allergies. The killer put Atropine Eye Drops into the victim s allergy eye drops. This diluted his eyes, made him very sensitive to sunlight, and eventually unable to fly the helicopter. As they were spiraling out of control, Conan's quick thinking saves their lives. He helps make a safe crash landing in a nearby schoolyard. Once landed they run for cover, as the helicopter's fuel lines, sparks, and then explodes. No one is seriously injured, but Conan gets a few cuts and bruises. However due to the Atropine Eye Drops, Tsuji cannot participate in the upcoming golfing event, as the effects of atropine last up to 2 weeks, way after the event which was only a few days away.
